justification: The article states that "the Deese-Roediger-McDermott (DRM) task [is] one of the most widely used" experimental methods developed to study the formation of false memories.

measured_by: maximum deviation from the direct path (MD) in mouse-tracking
justification: It explains that "decision conflict is quantified by computing the maximum deviation from the direct path (MD), i.e., the furthest point on the actual trajectory from the idealized straight trajectory."

measured_by: sample entropy of the mouse trajectory
justification: The paper notes that "the decision evolution is quantified by computing the sample entropy, which measures the irregularity and unpredictability degree of the trajectory (… the higher the value, the higher the conflict and the level of indecision)."
Initiation RT is described as "the time elapsed between the click on the START button and the first hand-movement, ... indicating the time at which the decisional process starts."
MDtime is defined as "the time at which the trajectory reaches the maximum distance (the time at which the decision is finally achieved)."

measured_by: frequency-weighted average cosine similarity from distributional semantic models
justification: The authors detail that SSim was "computed as the frequency-weighted average value of the cosines of the angles formed by the vectors" for each word pair, using vectors derived from a distributional semantic model.
